Articles.Content:
Hi all,

I've been playing KSP for about a month now (in Sandbox mode) and found this forum to be invaluable, so thanks to all who contribute to the community. Newbies like me are faced with a very steep learning curve so a lot of help is needed!

So far I have landed on the Mun 7 times (the last 4 were successful, the crews survived the first three attempts but weren't going to be going home in the lander they arrived in so those flights were reverted). I have sent a probe to Eve and several to Duna. I am currently working on a Duna lander (the first attempt did reach the surface but "landed" doing something above 300 m/s due to having run out of fuel early in the descent). Eventually I want to land Kerbals on Duna, and, if they are lucky, return them to Kerbin.

Welcome, Cool name!

Have fun and always remember, if something doesn't go wrong, your not playing right.

Welcome aboard! The learning curve is quite steep indeed. I remember seeing a quote that said "KSP doesn't have a learning curve- it has a learning WALL!"

Good luck in your travels!
